sentence.Network_en: The spill could wipe out the Gulf's turtle population.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次原油泄漏可能会使波斯湾的海龟灭绝。

sentence.Network_en: Utmost care must be taken not to spill any of the contents.
sentence.Network_cn: 千万注意里面的东西一点都不能洒出来。

sentence.Network_en: When the bell rings, more than 1,000 children spill from classrooms.
sentence.Network_cn: 当铃声响起时，1,000多名孩子从教室里涌了出来。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)无意中（或不慎）泄露秘密

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)reveal copious information to someone in an uninhibited way
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)无保留地透露大量信息，和盘托出

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English spillan 'kill, destroy, waste, shed (blood'); of unknown origin
Middle English (in the sense 'sharp fragment of wood'): obscurely related to spile. The current sense dates from the early 19th cent

encyclopedia.content: 注释 spill 英音：[spil]美音：[spɪl] vt. 使溢出，使流出；使摔下 vi. 溢出，流出；摔下；涌流 n. 溢出，溅出；溢出量；摔下；小塞子；小金属棒 过去式： spilled或spilt 过去分词： spilled或spilt 现在分词： spilling 常用例句 1.锛埮既换蛭抟馐兜仫級泼洒，使溅出，使溢出： to spill the soup out down the table 把汤洒到了餐桌上 Turn off the gas when the milk boils. Otherwise it will be spilt. 牛奶煮沸后

entry.def: If a liquid spills or if you spill it, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container.

example.ex: 70,000 tonnes of oil spilled from the tanker...
example.tran: 7 万吨油从油轮中溢了出来。

example.ex: ...water behind a dam, getting ready to spill over...
example.tran: 大坝里的水随时都会溢出来

entry.def: A spill is an amount of liquid that has spilled from a container.

example.ex: She wiped a spill of milkshake off the counter...
example.tran: 她把洒出来的奶昔从柜台上擦掉。

example.ex: An oil spill could be devastating for wildlife.
example.tran: 溢出的油对野生动物来说可能是毁灭性的。

entry.tran: (使)(袋子、盒子等中盛放的东西)洒出，涌出
entry.def: If the contents of a bag, box, or other container spill or are spilled, they come out of the container onto a surface.

example.ex: A number of bags had split and were spilling their contents...
example.tran: 有几只袋子裂开了，里面的东西撒了出来。

example.ex: He carefully balanced the satchel so that its contents would not spill out onto the floor.
example.tran: 他仔细地把小背包放好，不让里面的东西掉到地板上。

entry.def: If people or things spill out of a place, they come out of it in large numbers.

example.ex: Tears began to spill out of the boy's  eyes...
example.tran: 男孩的眼泪开始夺眶而出。

example.ex: When the bell rings, more than 1,000 children spill from classrooms.
example.tran: 当铃声响起时，1,000 多名孩子从教室里涌了出来。

entry.def: If light spills or is spilled into a place, it shines brightly into it, usually through a gap.

example.ex: She noticed the light spilling under Brian's  door...
example.tran: 她注意到布莱恩门底下透出的光。

example.ex: The door swung open again, spilling light into the cell.
example.tran: 门再次打开了，光照亮了小屋。

entry.def: If you spill someone's blood, you kill them or wound them.

example.ex: He is prepared to spill the blood of a million people...
If blood is spilled the countries will be at war.
example.tran: 如果出现伤亡，这些国家就会进入交战状态。

means.word_mean: 2. a channel that carries excess water over or around a dam or other obstruction
3. the act of allowing a fluid to escape
4. a sudden drop from an upright position;

sentences.sentence: "he had a nasty spill on the ice"

means.word_mean: 1. cause or allow (a liquid substance) to run or flow from a container;
2. flow, run or fall out and become lost;
3. cause or allow (a solid substance) to flow or run out or over;

sentences.sentence: "spill the beans all over the table"

means.word_mean: 4. pour out in drops or small quantities or as if in drops or small quantities;

sentences.sentence: "If you don't oblige me, I'll talk!"
"The former employee spilled all the details"

auth_sentence.content: The spill will have a very unique isotopic fingerprint.
auth_sentence.res_content: The spill will have a very unique isotopic fingerprint.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The spill will have a very unique isotopic fingerprint.

auth_sentence.content: What did we learn from the Gulf oil spill?
auth_sentence.res_content: What did we learn from the Gulf oil spill?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What did we learn from the Gulf oil spill?

auth_sentence.content: The BP spill gave additional momentum, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content: The BP spill gave additional momentum, he says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The BP spill gave additional momentum, he says.

Sentence.sentence: As our special report in this issue (printed before Mr Jobs's death) explains, innovation used to spill over from military and corporate laboratories to the consumer market, but lately this process has gone into reverse.
Part of the economic recovery of the UK will be driven by the next generation of research commercialisation spilling out of our universities.

sentences.en: The coffee is so full that it might spill over.
sentences.cn: 咖啡太满可能会溢出来。

sentences.en: The ship spilled oil while in port.
sentences.cn: 这艘船停泊港内时漏油。

sentences.en: We spill its content on the scrap quilt.
sentences.cn: 我们把其中的内容倾在被子上。

sentences.en: The carriage upset and we were all spilled into the ditch.
sentences.cn: 马车翻了, 我们都摔到了沟里。

sentences.en: He spilled it that Bill was their ringleader.
sentences.cn: 他透露比尔是他们的主谋。

jushi.english: Her long blond hair spilled down over her shoulders.
jushi.chinese: 她那金黄色的头发披垂在双肩。

jushi.english: The bus spilled and picked up its passengers at every stop.
jushi.chinese: 公共汽车在每一站都停下来让旅客上下车。

jushi.english: The coffee is so full that it might spill over .
